content: tunisian crochet pattern this fun and modern set of two striped dishcloths are worked in tunisian crochet simple stitch color changes are made on the return pass which gives the fabric a woven homespun look a simple single_crochet border is then added to finish it off two patterns are included - one for alternating 2 different colors and the second for alternating 3 different colors a worsted weight 100% cotton yarn is recommended knit picks *dishie* and hobby lobby *crafter s secret cotton* yarns were used in the pattern photos pattern details * please note this listing is for a pattern only * written in standard us terms * two separate written patterns are included one is for making a 2 color alternating stripes dishcloth and the other is for making a 3 color alternating stripes dishcloth * pattern instructions do not include a photo tutorial or stitch instructions for tunisian crochet stitches or techniques * pattern notes include a helpful stitch technique to keep edges tidy with color changes materials * 6 mm tunisian crochet hook * 5 5 mm crochet hook * 100% cotton worsted weight yarn in 3 coordinating colorways * scissors * tapestry needle * stitch marker * recommended * finished size * varies depending on yarn and/or hook size used but dishcloth size can be easily modified by adjusting the number of beginning chains and/or number of row worked - using knit picks dishie approximately 7 5 x 7 5 * with border and blocked * - using hobby lobby crafter s secret cotton approximately 8 x 8 * with border and blocked * skill level * previous experience and knowledge of tunisian crochet techniques including forward pass return pass tunisian simple stitch and slip_stitch bind off is recommended * pattern reading and knowledge of basic crochet stitches are also recommended crochet stitches used * chain * slip_stitch * single_crochet * tunisian simple stitch * slip_stitch bind off * yarn under * special technique instructions provided* use of pattern pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern and photographs contained in this document are all copyright of crochet hello rewriting reselling distributing or copying the pattern or its photos is prohibited share your work tag @crochet_hello or use the #crochethello and #homespundishcloth hashtags on instagram to share a picture of your work
